resources.string: TXTIFY is a utility that creates a .txt copy of any file. This is useful for uploading source code, scripts, or other documents to services that only accept plain text files, without altering your original file.

1. **Choose a Save Folder:** Use the side menu to select a permanent folder where all your .txt copies will be saved.\n 2. **Add Files:** Use "Browse Single File", "Batch Convert Files", or "Process ZIP File" from the menu to add files to the conversion queue.\n 3. **Convert:** Your added files will appear as a "project" on the main screen. Tap on it and confirm to save the .txt copies to your chosen folder.

- Your original files are never modified.\n - By default, if a file named `example.txt` already exists, a new copy will be named `example-1.txt`. You can change this behavior in Settings.\n - For Android 10 and above, you must grant folder permissions when prompted to ensure the app can save files.

- **"Permission Denied" Errors:** If you see errors about saving files, go to the side menu and use "Choose Save Folder" again to re-grant permission to your target directory.\n - **App Crashes:** If the app closes unexpectedly, please use the "Contact Us" button below to send us a message.
